item.title: Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Yen, Chikara and much more.

Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless is a comprehensive Roblox RPG where players develop their anime-inspired fighter by training five core stats, mastering special abilities, and defeating increasingly powerful enemies. The main objective revolves around continuously improving your character through the game’s “endless” progression system, unlocking powerful anime-inspired abilities, and watching your fighter evolve into a formidable combatant.

Advancement hinges on five core stats—Strength, Durability, Chakra, Sword, and Speed—each unlocking different combat abilities as you progress. Players earn Yen as the primary currency from defeating enemies and completing quests, which is spent on multiplier upgrades that dramatically increase training efficiency. The game features a unique Champion gacha system using Chikara currency, where rare Champions like Serious Saitama can provide massive stat multipliers to accelerate your growth. While these resources can be accumulated through regular gameplay, the fastest way to jump ahead is by redeeming promotional codes.

Active Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless Codes


Expired Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless Codes

As of the writing of this article, there are no expired codes, so players can redeem the active codes safely.

How To Redeem Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless Codes

Like most Roblox games, it is rather simple to redeem Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless codes. That being said, for players who may be new to the Roblox ecosystem, here is a step-by-step guide to redeeming Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless Codes:

  1. Boot up Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless in Roblox
  2. Find the arrow button in the bottom-left corner
  3. Click on it to scroll through the menu
  4. Find a blue icon, and click on it to open the code box
  5. Type or paste a code into the text box
  6. Click on enter and claim the freebie

Where To Get More Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless Codes

Anime Fighting Simulator: Endless codes are typically released through the game’s community and developer channels, but they don’t appear automatically in-game. The best places to catch them early are the official AFS: Endless Discord server, which has a dedicated codes channel where all new codes are posted first, and the developer’s social media accounts where they announce updates and milestones for this popular anime-inspired fighting game.

Codes often come out around game milestones but if you’re only checking sporadically, you’ll very easily miss them because no alert system tells players when a code drops—or when it stops working. Because of this, the easiest strategy is to save this guide in your browser and check back instead of trying to monitor every source yourself. This page is refreshed as soon as fresh codes go live, and any codes that have expired are taken out quickly so you always see only the ones that still work.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out how to stay safe when playing Roblox.

Enjoying our Roblox games codes coverage? Check out the codes for popular games like Steal A Brainrot, Radiant Residents, and Fix It Up on Insider Gaming!

Interested in the latest developments in the world of gaming and esports? Then join the Insider Gaming Discord server and engage with the passionate community.

item.title: Year In Review: Bethesda Must Go Back To The Drawing Board After DOOM: The Dark Ages
item.content:encoded:
Once I finished DOOM 2016 and DOOM: Eternal, I was excited to jump back in again. Less so Eternal, but it’s a fantastic sequel to the untouchable first reboot. DOOM: The Dark Ages is arguably the most complete and well-crafted of the trilogy, but I find it the least memorable and least replayable of the three.

In a bid to expand and evolve, The Dark Ages feels like an extension of its predecessors, more than a full-scale demonic overhaul. Furthermore, everything new mostly misses the mark, and can make the experience go from Imp to limp very quickly. id Software probably has an ideas board more bloated than a Mancubus after a Christmas Dinner, and there’s plenty of hope for the next trip to hell.

It Won’t Spell DOOM For The Franchise

I think DOOM is the quintessential first-person shooter franchise, as well as the most important one. Wolfenstein 3D helped the FPS genre crawl, but 1993’s DOOM stood on its own two feet—and throats of Baron of Hellish foes. Level design, music, the guns, the gore, and the thematic touches just exude a badass aura that few have even come close to.

Following DOOM 3’s survival-horror detour, there was a long wait for a new game. The infamous, canceled DOOM 4 project is better consigned to history, and thank our stars it was. We got the DOOM 2016 reboot instead—which I actually think is the best DOOM game everbut that’s for another conversation.

Eternal upped the speed and mobility and gave us Godmode Doomguy. I’ll never forgive the Marauders’ design, though, and I’ll die on that fiery hill! Both games are fantastic in their own unique right, and then you’ve got DOOM: The Dark Ages, which serves as a prequel. id Software decided to make its level design more open and chaotic, give us a Doomguy Dragon and Kaiju-inspired levels, and tighten up the game’s story with more cutscenes and character development.

In trying to do more, TDA does too much, and actually takes me away from the thing I enjoy most about DOOM: Killing lots of demons with fun weapons in small-to-medium-sized levels. But it’s still a good game!

Less Is More, More Or Less

Long story short…I don’t prioritise story when it comes to DOOM, and I’m sure I’m not alone in that sentiment. DOOM 1 and DOOM 2 achieve so much through visual and environmental cues and clues. How am I supposed to rip and tear when you won’t let me rip and tear? The Dark Ages’ Dragon levels are cumbersome and uninteresting, and while I can appreciate the attempt to freshen things up, the Mecha Doomguy sections are boring.

The shield and the slower-shield-based parry gameplay are solid, but you’re always aware that it’s a conscious effort to slow the game’s pace down (not as much as the Marauder, grr), and negatively juxtaposes the game’s identity. I’m not saying I want Doomguy to go shopping for some Sonic the Hedgehog shoes and borrow a Titanfall jetpack, but there needs to be a balance.

Ironically, I believe that balance is still DOOM 2016.

id nailed everything with the game. I’d like to see the next DOOM game be more akin to 2016, and maybe borrow the odd bit of parkour from Eternal, and even some of The Dark Ages’ incredible visual aesthetic. It also wouldn’t hurt to broker peace with Mick Gordon, I beg. In the same way that DOOM 3 was starting to steer the ship away and veer off on a completely different course, I think the same needs to happen again now.

The series is as popular as ever, but it felt like everyone forgot about it as 2025 went on. Let’s fuse old-school and new-school DOOM again. Finding key cards in well-designed levels that don’t just rely on being open, and adding depth with hidden platforms and switches galore. A beastly soundtrack supported by grizzly battle scenes is also a must. Let’s waste less budget on theatrics and inject that into R&D on fun gameplay mechanics and ideas, and re-reboot DOOM again.

What do you think id and Bethesda got wrong with DOOM: The Dark Ages? What needs to happen for the next iteration? Head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and share your thoughts.

If you like DOOM, it’s definitely time to check out IG’s DOOM games ranked from worst to best list, and the 9 best DOOM weapons ever ranked

item.title: One Of Us Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox One of Us monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Coins and much more. 

One of Us is a Roblox survival experience that assigns players to either Survivors or a Killer. The Killer must eliminate the Survivors to win, while the Survivors must outlast or escape the Killer. The game also features multiple classes for both Survivors and Killers, however, to use them, you must purchase them with Coins. This currency is earned by performing well in matches, but another way to gain free Coins is by redeeming active codes. These codes are easy to redeem and let you claim thousands of Coins without being glued to your chair.

Active One of Us Codes

  • 30KLIKES – C$700 Coins (New)
  • 25KLIKES – C$675 
  • 22KLIKES – C$650 
  • 18KLIKES – C$600 
  • 15KLIKES – C$575 
  • 14KLIKES – C$550

Inactive One of Us Codes

This Roblox game doesn’t have any invalid codes right now. Whenever an active code expires, it’ll be listed here. 

How to redeem One of Us Codes

Follow the easy steps listed below to redeem all the active codes in One of Us: 

  1. Launch One of Us and connect to the lobby. 
  2. Press the “</>” button on the left top corner. 
  3. Enter any code into the “Enter Code…” box. 
  4. Press the “REDEEM” button to claim the free Coins. 

More about One of Us Codes 

The Coins claimed from active codes will boost your treasury and help you unlock better Survivor and Killer classes. That said, grinding for Coins is a tedious and time-consuming task. Free Coins put you ahead of the level requirements for both Killers and Survivors, letting you to purchase classes using Bypass fees. These Bypass prices vary depending on the Survivor or Killer. However, if you level up and reach the required level naturally, the class prices go back to their normal cost. Here are all the Survivors and Killers that can be purchased using the free Coins: 

One of Us Killers:

One of Us Survivors:

FAQs on One of Us Codes 

What are the latest active codes? 

30KLIKES is the only latest active code. 

When are new codes for released? 

Expect new codes for to drop during milestones on Roblox. Bookmark this article to stay updated with the latest codes. 

Where to find new codes?

Usually, the new ones are posted on the game’s official Roblox homepage. For quicker access, you can keep track of our active codes list.

Having fun using codes in Roblox games? Then check out the latest codes for 99 Nights in the Forest, Type Soul, and Azure Latch. Also, check out the Insider Gaming Discord server.
